H0.text: What name, meaning sewer in Latin, is given to the singular bodily orifice found in birds, reptiles and amphibian that is used for both excretory and reproductive functions. Urethra

H1.text: What name, meaning sewer in Latin, is given to the singular bodily orifice found in birds, reptiles and amphibian that is used for both excretory and reproductive functions. Ostium

H2.text: What name, meaning sewer in Latin, is given to the singular bodily orifice found in birds, reptiles and amphibian that is used for both excretory and reproductive functions. Vagina

H3.text: What name, meaning sewer in Latin, is given to the singular bodily orifice found in birds, reptiles and amphibian that is used for both excretory and reproductive functions. Cloaca

A4.text: A cloaca is the rear orifice that serves as the only opening for the digestive (rectum), reproductive, and urinary tracts of many vertebrate animals.

A5.text: The word is from the Latin verb cluo, '(I) cleanse', thus the noun cloaca, 'sewer, drain'.
